reviews.review_msg: Susan is passionate and highly qualified for this course topic; which is what you would want from a professor. Unfortunately shes too harsh on students. She interrupts students after a few words and tells them that they are wrong. Her tone is condescending which makes lectures very uncomfortable. We get it, you went to Sierra Leone and cured ebola.

do not take this class with her. Not impossible to get a good grade but she is the absolute worst. 80% of your grade is based on quizzes and they are based off insignifigant details from readings. she constantly tells students they are wrong on something opinion based and interupts them. very unapproachable and generally rude.

No laptops in class made note taking inconvenient. Quizzes focused on insignificant details of readings rather than overall understanding making it hard to do well. Also didnt like that she often interrupts students while in the midst of answering a question. Only half the class would show up for lecture, I think because of her teaching style.

I am currently taking a class of hers. The subject itself isn't hard to understand however she twists and turns her words which can complicate things. And the fact thag her slides don't contain all the information, makes it so you have to come everyday. 

She is quite condescending, and lacks empathy for students.

She's an amazing prof. She has her own principles, for sure, but once you figure them out, she is extremely nice and passionate about her job. Best prof I've ever gotten at FIC. She can be a bit rough if you are late, but she is not a tough professor.

She requires you to remember many concepts in HSCI. Her exam is application-based, and you must know a lot of concepts to get a good grade. Even though the exam is hard, the recorded group presentation, oral exam, and online assignments make the course seem easier.
Just avoid, my experience in her class was less than satisfactory!

The prof's lectures are a little dry. She explains concepts briefly but when asked questions can be condescending. I felt bad for the TM because she had to act as a TA even though it wasn't her job. The prof's marking rubric was very difficult.

Slides have blanks so you need to attend the class. Her lectures are okay-ish, not that hard. 2 quizzes, 1 individual assignment, 1 group project, 1 online assignment (pretty easy). She is a bit intimidating. Gives plenty of time for the assignments. 
The TA marked the assignment did not like her style of giving feedback, very unclear.
Completely up-helpful, marked things wrong and refused to fix them despite it being an obvious mistake. Rude and hard to reach outside of class.
whoever this prof is tell her to stop cooking in hsci. you will end up being more productive looking at a wall than taking her classes.

Not a great prof at all. Her lectures are incredibly boring, waste of time and shouldn't be three hours long. The quizzes are complete nonsense and her marking makes no sense. The TA is also completely wack. I asked her why I lost marks on the assignment and she had no clue what she was saying or why I lost marks. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Mandana was super nice and understanding and a great instructor. You have to put in a lot of work for this course for the oral exams. If you just pay attention in class during the lectures, the quizzes would be a breeze. 
The group projects are fun and She gives good feedback.
So, it's easy to pass mostly and it's also easy to fail
Professor Mandana gives a lot of feedback. She has a great quality of engaging her class. For a Matt let of fact she is loved by all her students. I love herjust like the rest of the students:)

I don't understand some of the complaints on here, especially the ones that don't make sense grammatically. Mandana works really hard - goes the extra mile right now when we're online, doing live classes and being there for students for the whole class.
Run away when you see her name. She is very tough and not make sense when marking essay
I don't know why so many students complain about her. Her tests were tough, but I think that she makes it clear what she expected. She is a friendly instructor and its fun to talk to her.

Class is easy but her marking doesnt make alot of sense especially if its subjective work (essay). Teaching level would be acceptable from a community college or high school level. I can see she's gotten a lot of negative reviews recently, which (maybe) due to the shift to online as I've never had her in person, but so far not impressed. Avoid
The class itself is easy but the instructor makes it so hard. I DO NOT RECOMMEND HER AT ALL,HER CLASS IS JUST A WASTE OF TIME!!
Just avoid her and youll feel better, in my opinion she is not really a university level teacher.

study a lot fr oral exam because number of pages you have to read is so much more than 100 pages and you need to review them. She won't give you good marks easily. Activity during the class has a bit effect on your grade.

She is by far the WORST professor in SFU & FIC. I feel like she should see her rating herself and try to improve on her way of teaching. I took this course and being honest I did studied hard for this course but she wants exact answers to her question. In simple English a PROF cannot be WORST than her. I am warning students from taking her class
Lol waste of money. Easy class. Difficult person. 0 if I could

Very straightforward class - if you show up, take notes and study even a little before quizzes you will do well. The content is easy but interesting, and Salajegheh makes things very clear and gives good explanations. The textbook was not necessary for the course - she goes over everything you need in lecture!
Shes pretty straightforward in her lectures and her slides are fairly easy to understand. Quiz questions can be a bit tricky as they are very specific.
It is a very easy course but you need to present in all her classes specially first day of her class and she is really hard taking.

If youre interested in global heath, this class is an easy GPA boost. Mandana is an amazing speaker and very knowledgeable on the subjects discussed. If you attend lectures and take notes, its an easy course. Her slides dont include all of what you need to know and she adds important and testable information as she speaks. Tests are very fair.

I took her HSCI160 class. She's definitely tough but it's actually not that bad. Show up, listen during lecture and she literally gives hints on what to study and you'll pass. Can't deny that I'm one of the "very few A students" of her but I don't think she's as awful as people believe, just a little more on the strict side.

Terrible Prof. Doesn't care about being available outside of class. You need to make appointments with her so she knows she can be at office hours. Quizzes are actually quite difficult, as no one got perfect. Lectures heavy in 3 hours but their good. Honestly, I thought i would've done way better.
She improves your critical thinking skills but it is hard to get an A in her class.
One of the best professors. Highly recommend her as she is a very engaging instructor and a highly knowledgeable personal who knows her stuff. Much respect :)
I really dont recommend her.

She is a great teacher. Honestly, she is totally different to the way she expresses herself, every warmhearted. Once I got depression, she encouraged and did everything to help me get over and feel comfortable. Her lecture is straightforward. Sometimes, she adds more information which could be in quizzes. Thank you Mandana <3

Nice Professor first, but didnt like her attitude for sarcasming group of students just because of some individuals (generalizing). Aggressive tricky questions always and most students feel a bit stressful, but somehow is effective teaching style. She gives extra scores for the quiz if u get higher score in the second one! Be polite and respectful
She will tell u what you need to know in class. DO THE REVIEW QUESTIONS and READ HER LECTURE NOTES!
She's really an amazing teacher. The lecture can add more in your general knowledge about health, economy, politics, and social internationally. Attendance is mandatory. She is very on time person.

Dresses very well. I took Global Health with her. Very clear about coming to class on time. Makes it very clear in the beginning. If you want to pass her course, never be late and participate in class. Pretty easy class in general, quizzes consist of basic well known information.

she's super nice and kind and super helpful. many people said that she's terrible etc but its not as long as you attend her class, do all assignments and quizzes very well, and make a notes from her lecture notes, you'll pass the class.
Focus on your notes and you'll be fine.  Clear lectures
Manda is really nice, her lectures are interesting. Easy course to pass just have to show up listen during lectures and do the works, and you shall pass.
Just the best
Interesting video Inspiring lectures Easy quizs and assignments Best prof i ever had :)                     i'm just kidding, good luck w that B :)

I don't know why there are so many bad reviews. I thought she was a great prof with super straight forward notes and exams. As long as you attend and listen in lecture and really make sure you know the slides it is an easy A. I thought the project was tedious and a waste of time but overall I definitely recommend taking this class with her.

4 non-cumulative 30 mark quizzes, no mid, no final, 2 individual assignments. Her lectures are basically her reading the slides, but you need to go because she has fill-in-the blanks. Quizzes are tricky, study the very specific details and you will do well.

If you're looking for an easy class to balance out a heavy semester, this is a good one to take. Minimal effort required for the grades received. Can't stand her teaching style though (if you can even call it that). She reads off the slides which come straight from the textbook. She's pretty boring, but overall it's an easy class.
She's the most arrogant professor. Die but don't take this course with her!!

she is amazing, took her course in fic, it was preety easy, in class quizzes only objectives an assignment and final presentation worth 25. i got a b- because i didnt even study. i recommend her if you are looking for a gpa booster in fic.
she is not good at all. will never suggest anyone to take class with her.

She explained information accurately. It was an absolute pleasure in attending her lectures. Her examples would help in remembering important information. Very approachable lecturer.Course was challenging . Glad i took that course .

Awful. He seemed nice at first but it didn't turn out that way. Disrespectful to students who ask questions, unclear grading criteria, inconsiderate, very difficult quizzes. Extremely lazy, a big chunk of the material came from an outside source that he just pasted a link to. Has no idea how to use technology and tends to ramble.

Fairly passionate about what he's talking about. Didn't seem very approachable and was a little rude to people who asked questions on canvas discussion boards. Pretty easy grader kinda difficult quizzes

Your grade is mostly based on papers, so as long as you know how to research and be 'self motivated' you'll do well in this class. Prof. O'Neil is super passionate and cares a lot about the material covered, although the 3 hour lectures definitely get long, plus everything that is on the slides is covered in the textbook.
Very kind, knowledgable, and helpful professor and the course material is extremely interesting. Only minor con is that he struggles with technology

Dr. O'Neil is truly one of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures are informative and he is really passionate about public health. It was really interesting to learn about his experiences in the field and has inspired me to pursue a career in the health sciences. Would highly recommend!

Most boring lectures ever. If you have taken any sort of global politics/ human geography in Highschool, you will already know most of the material. Lectures are slow moving, difficult to take notes for, and put me to sleep. There is no final, only online quizzes that can be passed using common sense.

Kate is one of the talented individuals I have ever met. She is really talented and qualified. She welcomes students from all faculty. Her Armenian accent makes the lecture great! Her 2 QUIZZES are really tough, you have to surely stress about it. 30 mins for 30 MCQs and it is really hard. But to be honest, if you attend the class u learn sth.

She's really sweet but hated her way of teaching the course. Not enough time for the quizzes and I know there are lots of group projects in university but for this class it was such a pain. The group project involved a 10 page essay and also a video, worth 40%. The video was unnecessary and a drag especially if you're stuck with a bad group.

I have mixed feelings about Kate. She seems very kind at first but it's not alwasy the case. She's very irritable and a bit condescending when people answer questions in class. She is understanding and gives second chances if you prove your case for assingnments. Tends to get angry at the people who DID show up because of those who skipped, odd!

Tries very hard to be likeable but comes off as arrogant and self-interested. A finicky group project with a video component is the majority of your grade. Online quizzes were relatively easy and were predominantly based on the textbook. Kept adding extra participation assignments on Canvas with no notifications during the exam week.

Prof Tairyan started the term with a wonderful intro to what we shall expect in the term. She always emails and reminds us of projects or quizzes. Her lectures are easy to follow through. You can really see that she has a passion for this topic and for the students.

This class is taught like an online class. There's zero need to show up. Prof asks students cheeky questions and then doesn't actually listen or attempt to understand their answers. Grading takes FOREVER. Breaks are infrequent or nonexistent. Lectures frequently go over time. Prof very enamoured with herself. Group project was a nightmare.

Her group project assignment is unreasonable and is worth 40%, I rather have an exam. Two online quizzes and not enough time to finish. Her lectures are really boring. She even said no one really gets an A in this class. She's not a very good prof. All she does is come to class and read off the slides. Maybe that's the reason why no one gets A's.

You lose marks over nothing. Her assignments are hard and most students failed it or was close to failing it, there are 2 hard online quizzes and each are 30 multiple choice questions and you only get 30 mins to finish it which is not enough time, especially for people who can't speak English properly. Unreasonable expectations for first year.
The most boring 3 hour lectures and she rarely gives 2 breaks, avoid taking it with her

Kate is an extremely kind and passionate prof, would definitely recommend her when taking this course. The course was pretty easy, but the lectures were long and boring. Textbooks are not required for this course, everything on the quizzes are on the lecture slides.

Kate is so nice and very passionate, but I have never experienced a more disorganized and technology challenged professor. Kate also expects you to read her mind, she doesn't give any clear grading scheme for assignments or any formatting but then takes marks off for not following format.

Kate's a very kind person who wants the best for her students. With that being said, the marking scheme for anything is MIA  and marked solely by a grading ta, who in  my case only accepted one method of presenting something. When asked to look over graded projects, an ultimatum of a remark was given without seeing small errors the ta could've made
The nicest teacher I have had. Easy and interesting class to take. She is really passionate and makes a lot of effort to share her enthusiasm.

One of the most kindest and loveable lecturers and really, i mean really cares about her students. Though 3 hour lectures are long she does try to make them bearable. I would rather prefer a 2 hour and 1 hour lecture split. Nevertheless, I'm glad I took this course with Kate, shes the best and i hope to take more classes with her in the future.

Kate might be the kindest, most beautiful soul I have ever met on this planet. Her goal is to make you succeed. Lectures were 3 hours long, but she did her best to make them as bearable and enjoyable as possible. I don't understand how anyone could not absolutely love this woman.
She is the nicest prof I've ever had. She is easy and is always willing to help. she is passionate about her work and gives easy marks. just attend class and do the assignments then you'll get an A

Dr. Tairyan was simply one of the best profs I've ever had. She was inspiration, dedicated, and truly cared about us as students! I would recommend this class to anyone who is eager to learn about global health, as Kate is the best. The class is what you make it. GET INVOLVED! SAY HI! Kate will do nothing but help you along the way.
she is nice and has hat stories that make us feel empowered

She is the worst Pro I have ever seen!!!! Kate does not treat kindly her students and talks about the same thing over and over. Pls be aware that it is not an "A" course because She changed her style. Pls, Pls find another pro to take it.

She was the best pro I ever met at the very beginning of this semester. But now, I think she is the worst. During the lectures, she repeats all the time. No matter it is important or not. And she is so mean in our group presentation by asking strange questions. She makes students so embarrassed in front of other students.  etc..
Sooooo nice
She is simply the best. Multiple quizzes and NO final. Overall, she is nice, passionate, and friendly. Study normally and good grade is guaranteed. Very reasonable prof!

Course covered many topics regarding general health of other nations, specifically, third-world countries. Minimal work required, just some reading, three quizzes, and an individual and group assignment. No midterm or final. Easy class, but entertaining enough to attend and learn.

Kate was awesome! Her goal was to facilitate our understanding of global health, without the unnecessary stress. Fantastic teaching philosophy. I truly learned a lot from Kate. The marking was really quite easy and the group project was enjoyable. Take this class not just because it's a GPA booster, but because you want to grow as a human being.
Very nice prof, easy material, very informative, bon class
A true treasure. A wonderful professor, and a wonderful human being. Dr. Tairyan is one of the most beautiful people I have ever met, I feel blessed to have learned so much from her.
Very nice prof. Easy course.

Interesting and easy class. Readings were interesting but the class itself was a waster of time. But shes an easy marker, really nice, experienced and passionate about her field. In summary, the class is easy and she is hot. Take this course for an A.

Kate is super nice and approachable. This class has so much potential but because of the hours (3 hours straight once a week, no tutorials, no midterm or exam), it's tough to find a reason to pay attention. She has trouble keeping the class because of this but she's really knowledgeable about the subject matter and is really kind to her students

160 is a great course to take especially with Kate...she is super nice very approachable her lecture were interesting but we never really managed to get through them all as she would go off topic sometimes but her quizzes and projects were very easy just had to read your notes ..classes were interesting so i always went, overall a good teacher!

A very enthusiastic prof who is always willing to help out.  She cares about all the students and tries to make each class interesting.  The course is excellent-very relevant to the world today and one that i think everyone should take.
Don't bother buying the textbook. Read the lecture slides and you'll be fine!! He's an amazing guy.

Nice guy, but not a very good professor. Asked me and a few friends to help him hand out exams and proceeded to start the test while we were still handing them out. Class isn't necessarily hard, but Mr. Myint sure does make it stressful and confusing.

I would most definitely recommend him as a prof for any HSCI course at SFU. He is very educated and is very passionate. GPA BOOSTER!! He is EXTREMELY reasonable on the amount of work he assigns. Though, he LOVES group projects so make sure you pick your group wisely. Not much to do but the projects are tedious and worth a lot. but no exams at all!!

Easiest course ever and the best prof. His accent makes it difficult to understand, but he is amazing. His exams are straightforward and just put a little bit of work into projects and it's a huge GPA booster. Would take it again with this prof! Very reasonable and fair and wants his students to succeed.
Gives you exam questions, just have to memorize them all
Mr. Myint is a great teacher. Very helpful and quick with the e-mail. His lecture are quite straight forward and easy to understand. He is always willing to help. I would definitely took him again.
Very understanding, and marks well. HSCI 160 was easy to balance with harder 4 credit courses would definitely recommend with Dr.Kaida!

Angela Kaida is a great professor who cares about what she teaches! The assignments were easy to understand and the course load was not overly intense at all. There were two canvas quizzes and three assignments in the entire semester but I had a lot of time to do them and enjoyed it. Definitely take a class with her!!

DO NOT take this class with Nicole Berry. This should be a simple and fun course! not a headache and a pain in the butt! Yes you have to put in hard work to see results but she is unreasonable and her grading is crazy. Save yourself the time and take it with a different prof!

Nicole is super knowledgable in her field, incredibly approachable, and someone who genuinely wants her students to be a better person because of the class. Her exam wording is kinda vague and it's quite a bit of memorization, but it's little work for a 100 level class and I would highly recommend her class for arts minded students

Because of using very weird wording on exams, all exams are BRUTAL. Thus, It is NOT easy. This was THE problem for most students. (When I saw the weird wording on exams, I thought She wanted us to fail.) Also, the first exam had only 25 m/c Qs the first 10 weeks of lectures. YOU GET ONE WRONG ANSWER then YOU LOSE hugh %. This is horrible.

Nicole is very knowledgeable in her field. There is definitely too much work for a first year class but its easy. Exams are difficult only because she uses really weird wording. She speaks a bit too fast but welcomes students asking her to slow down. Seems like she's still figuring out how to teach this class, but always asks for suggestions.

TOO MUCH readings, assignments,and group activities for 100 level course. You allow to bring a cue card on 2 exams but it is USELESS. Exams were pretty BRUTAL. She is very disorganized and makes everything complex. She speaks SO FAST. You will experience HEADACHE after lecture. AVOID HER IF YOU CAN!

Nicole was very nice, funny, and helpful. i definitly recommend taking her course, but just stay on top of things because there are a more than a couple assignments throughout the course. also, she is always open to e-mails and is quick to respond.
Interesting class! She is very helpful and considerate of her students, and she replies emails so quickly which I really appreciate. Don't really like how she grades though (her point system).

She prepares her notes at the last minute so you can't get them in advance unless you get them an hour before the lecture. She talks quickly so you can't write down everything she says unless you have a computer or her notes printed out. Other than that she is super nice, answers questions really well and is willing to help out of class.

Nicole is awesome! I don't know what she's had poor ratings. She is extremely knowledgeable, has very interesting lectures and treats students like adults...not like high school kids! She's always willing to help and she's a wicked Prof. I Love her class.

Really disorganized and lacks clarity when taking notes i couldnt take down her notes typing.  She moves too fast and prepares her lectures at the very last minute, therefore having several spelling errors
Excellent professor with high interest in course material.

If you READ the text and can understand general concepts this course is a breeze.  I found most students can't do that, and as a result did very poorly in class.  She is pretty straight forward (though she talks very quickly).  The only downfall was that the exams were based on student questions that seemed unedited thus hard to understand.

She is so incredibly disorganized. Slides were prepared during class and didnt contain any information from the book, she only took information that the students gave her and put them on the slides during lec. Also, this course was based on "points" which was odd. Nothing was graded on percentage. I would not take a course with this prof ever again
No Comments
